alert.note: Alert for Coastal St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 5:10PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern St. Lucie County through 545 PM EDT... At 509 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fort Pierce, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Pierce, Indrio, Fort Pierce Inlet, White City and Queens Cove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central Florida.
